answers.answer: stress can increase your hormone levels and can also increase your pressure -- all may contribute to certain types of stroke.   it is, however, only a minor factor in the presence of risk factors otherwise (hypertension, diabetes, cholesterol, obesity, smoking, etc.   or severe family history)

question: how is stress a contributory factor even though the body was behaving differently a few days before the stroke?
title: can a stroke be caused by stress
